main event: On 5 February 1953, a civilian observer in King Salmon, Alaska, reported seeing an unusual light in the sky, which was later concluded to be a planet, likely Venus.
interesting points: The observation lasted for about 5 minutes., The light was described as changing colors and performing various pulsating movements., There was a temperature inversion at the time of the sighting., The F-94B jet fighters were grounded during the observation period., Multiple witnesses, including an Air Force officer, reported seeing the unusual light.
sighted object: an unusual light in the sky
witness description: one USAF officer and one CAA operations representative
